p: Plant growth within each species varied dramatically by plot ( Fig 3). Predictors of plant growth in linear mixed models varied between species ( Table 5), and for two of the three species, the base model held the most weight (Tables in S5â€“ S7 Tables). Elevation and soil moisture were not predictive of plant growth in any top models ( Table 6). The model predicting growth per day for C. oahuense indicated that initial seedling height negatively influenced growth over time, and that as temperature range increased, growth rate increased for seedlings from low elevation origin. The random effect of plot explained approximately 18% of the model variance (ICC = 0.184).
